sen.j: 九条 幸教（くじょう ゆきのり、元禄13年5月16日 (旧暦)（1700年7月2日） - 享保13年5月26日 (旧暦)（1728年7月3日））は江戸時代の公卿。
sen.e: Yukinori KUJO (July 2, 1700 - July 3, 1728) was kugyo (high court noble) in the Edo period.
Yukinori KUJO (July 2, 1700 - July 3, 1728) was a Court noble who lived during the Edo period.
sen.cmt: 公卿を Court nobleとし、また 用語統一の「レビュー結果」（2009/7/31）に従い、inの部分を who lived duringに修正致しました。
sen.e: Yukinori KUJO (July 2, 1700 - July 3, 1728) was a Court noble who lived during the Edo period.
His father was Sukezane KUJO.
His father was Sukezane KUJO.
His father was Sukezane KUJO.
His mother was Imperial Princess Masuko.
His mother was Imperial Princess Masuko.
His mother was Imperial Princess Masuko.

sen.j: 兄弟に九条師孝、九条尚実。
sen.e: Morotaka KUJO and Naozane KUJO were his brothers.
Morotaka KUJO and Naozane KUJO were his brothers.
Morotaka KUJO and Naozane KUJO were his brothers.
His alias was Muryosinin (無量信院).
He called himself Muryosinin (無量信院).
He called himself Muryosinin (無量信院).

sen.j: 子は九条稙基、二条宗基。
sen.e: He had sons, Tanemoto KUJO and Munemoto NIJO.
Tanemoto KUJO and Munemoto NIJO were his sons.
sen.cmt: 語順を修正致しました。
sen.e: Tanemoto KUJO and Munemoto NIJO were his sons.

sen.j: 室は千姫（徳川吉通次女、徳川継友養女）。
sen.e: His wife was Senhime (the second daughter of Yoshimichi TOKUGAWA and adapted by Tsugutomo TOKUGAWA).
His wife was Senhime (Yoshimichi TOKUGAWA's second daughter who was adopted by Tsugutomo TOKUGAWA).
sen.cmt: adapted byをadopted byに修正致しました。
sen.e: His wife was Senhime (Yoshimichi TOKUGAWA's second daughter who was adopted by Tsugutomo TOKUGAWA).
His court official rank was Junii (Junior Second Rank).
His court official rank was Junii (Junior Second Rank).
His court official rank was Junii (Junior Second Rank).

sen.j: 元禄13年（1700年）九条実輔の子として生まれる。
sen.e: He was born to Sukezane KUJO in 1700.
He was born to Sukezane KUJO in 1700.
He was born to Sukezane KUJO in 1700.

sen.j: 享保2年（1717年）7月13日 (旧暦)叙従三位。
sen.e: He was promoted to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) on July 13, 1717.
He rose to the rank of Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) on August 19, 1717.
sen.cmt: 位が上がったため rose to に変え、日付を新暦に修正致しました。
sen.e: He rose to the rank of Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) on August 19, 1717.
He held various posts such as Naidaijin (Minister of the Center) (1726 - 1728).
He held various posts such as Naidaijin (Minister of the Center) (1726 - 1728).
He held various posts such as Naidaijin (Minister of the Center) (1726 - 1728).
He died in 1728.
He died in 1728.
He died in 1728.
